com.pump.io

Class ByteEncoder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pump.io.ByteEncoder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ChainedByteEncoder, Scrambler.Layer

    public abstract class ByteEncoder
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    This object encodes a series of bytes (expressed as [0,255] integers).

    This data can be made available either in a dual-threaded push/pull model, or in a single-threaded model by using the inner ByteEncoder.DataListener interface.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  ByteEncoder.DataListener
      This is notified when data is available or when an encoder is closed.
      protected class  ByteEncoder.EncodedInputStream
      This filters an InputStream through this encoder.

        public ByteEncoder()

    • Method Detail

      • setListener

        public void setListener(ByteEncoder.DataListener listener)
        Assign a DataListener for this encoder.

        An encoder only has 1 listener at a time, so you cannot add multiple listeners.

        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to assign. This replaces any previously assigned listener.

      • getDataListener

        public ByteEncoder.DataListener getDataListener()
        Return the existing DataListener that has already been assigned to this encoder.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        This indicates that no more data will be made available.

        Subsequent calls to push() will result in an IllegalStateException. Calling this method may immediately release new data (which you can access by calling pullImmediately).

        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        push(int), pull()

      • pull

        public int[] pull()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Pull a series of bytes (all within [0,255]) as they become available.
        Returns:
        encoded bytes, or null if if close() has been called.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        pullImmediately(), push(int), close()

      • push

        public abstract void push(int b)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Push a byte for this encoder to process.

        As data accumulates it will eventually have to be retrieved via the pull() method. This method may block if data is waiting to be retrieved.

        Parameters:
        b - a byte from [0, 255]
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        pull(), close()

      • flush

        protected abstract void flush()
                       throws java.io.IOException
        This is exclusively called during close() to give this encoder an opportunity to write any remaining data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • pullImmediately

        public int[] pullImmediately()
        This will return one of three things: an array of available bytes, an empty array if no data is available, or null if this encoder has been closed.
        Returns:
        One of three things: an array of available bytes, an empty array if no data is available, or null if this encoder has been closed.
        See Also:
        pull(), push(int), close()

      • pushChunk

        protected void pushChunk(int[] data)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Make a chunk of data available to be read. If there is any data that hasn't been processed yet, then this method may block until previously pushed chunks are cleared by calling pull().
        Parameters:
        data - a chunk of data that is ready to be pulled.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • encode

        public java.lang.String encode(java.lang.String string)
        Encode a String using UTF-8.

        This breaks the String into an array of bytes, passes the bytes through this encoder, and returns the resulting bytes re-assembled in a String using UTF-8.

        Parameters:
        string - the String to encode.
        Returns:
        the encoded String.

      • encode

        public java.lang.String encode(java.lang.String string,
                               java.nio.charset.Charset charset)
        Encode a String.

        This breaks the String into an array of bytes, passes the bytes through this encoder, and returns the resulting bytes re-assembled into a String.

        Parameters:
        string - the String to encode.
        charset - the charset to convert the String to byte data.
        Returns:
        the encoded String.

      • encode

        public byte[] encode(byte[] data)
        Encode an array of bytes.
        Parameters:
        data - the bytes to encode.
        Returns:
        the encoded bytes.
